full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
### Contract Details
#### Details of Award Notice:
Title: GPS Radio-Collars

Category: Goods
 UNSPSC Classification: Radar and Sonar Systems and Components (41115200)

Contracting Entity: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)

### Tender Details
* Solicitation Number: WS3666425580
* Amendment Number: 1
* Publication Date: September 22, 2022
* Tender Closing Date: October 11, 2022, 14:00:00 (MDT)
* Expected Contract Start Date: November 1, 2022

### Terms and Conditions
This tender is subject to the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and other applicable trade agreements.

### End-User Information
The end-users of the goods and services are Parks Canada Agency (PC).

### Contact Information
For more information, please contact:
Roxanne Kunz, Procurement Agent
Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
Phone: (TEL NOT AVAILABLE)
Email: [roxanne.kunz@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:roxanne.kunz@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
### Notice URL
To view the tender notice, click on the following link: 
http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14180699?extsite=MTQxODA2OTlfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

### Tender Description
Parks Canada Agency requires GPS (Iridium network) radio-collars with VHF and data management service to monitor wolf movement and behavior in Wood Buffalo National Park, Alberta. The agency requests delivery by January 31, 2023.

### Notice Type
This is an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN). An ACAN is a public notice indicating to the supplier community that a department or agency intends to award a contract for goods, services or construction to a pre-identified supplier. This allows other suppliers to signal their interest in bidding by submitting a statement of capabilities.

### Modification to Tender Closing Time
Please disregard the original closing times stated in the Ariba Discovery posting and CanadaBuys posting. You must submit your statement of capability by October 11, 2022, 14:00:00 (MDT). Note that excluded trade agreements identify significant Canada–specific involvement
